intro: Ormosia cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas ormosia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a source of food for various animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
